intro: Polygala paniculata var. carlotina, commonly known as the Carlotina milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is a perennial shrub characterized by its compound leaves and showy, spiny inflorescences. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers that are clustered in panicles, giving it its species name. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool, moist conditions. Due to its unique morphology and restricted distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
